sn45.18:4.2: At one time Venerables Ānanda and Bhadda were staying at Pāṭaliputta, in the Chicken Monastery.
sn45.18:4.3: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Bhadda came out of solitude, went to Venerable Ānanda,
sn45.18:4.5: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side,
sn45.18:5.1: “Reverend, they speak of this thing called ‘not the spiritual path’.
sn45.18:5.2: What is not the spiritual path?”
sn45.18:5.4: Your approach and articulation are excellent, and it’s a good question.
sn45.18:5.6: ‘They speak of this thing called “not the spiritual path”.
sn45.18:5.7: What is not the spiritual path?’”
sn45.18:5.9: “What is not the spiritual path is simply the wrong eightfold path, that is:
sn45.18:5.10: Wrong view, wrong motivation, wrong speech, wrong action, wrong livelihood, wrong effort, wrong mindfulness, and wrong samādhi.”
